summary: This is one part of the \"Balanced Crafting Project\" mod. This part only balances the Smithing skill tree and perks. Smithing is seriously overpowerd in vanilla.
descriptionHtml:
[center][b]NOTICE:
 Please use the \"[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10521]ACE - Crafting[/url]\" mod instead of this mod!
 * http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10521 *
This mod will not receive regular updates. [/b][/center]


 This is just one part of that mod which only balances the Smithing skill tree and perks.
 The full mod also balances the fortify potions and enchants and the enchanting skill tree and perks.
 This part is here in case there are conflicts with the full mod but you still want to use some of the features.

[color=008000][size=4][b]What this Mod does[/b][/size][/color]
[color=008080][size=3][b] Smithing[/b][/size][/color]
- Weaponsmith: 25% / 40% (Affects all weapons in the game)
- Master Weaponsmith: 50% at lvl 100
- Armorsmith: 25% / 40% (Affects all armors in the game)
- Master Armorsmith: 50% at lvl 100
- Arcane Blacksmith: requires Weaponsmith, Armorsmith and lvl 30
- Crafting perks also ignore 5% armor against enemies wearing that type of armor.
- The Smithing tree looks like an Anvil! (Really really close!) 
 
[color=008080][size=3][b] Results at maxed trees[/b][/size][/color]
- Weapon and armor tempering 50% (vanilla is 100% regardless of Smithing lvl)
- 5% ignored armor against all enemies wearing armor the player can craft

[color=008000][size=4][b]Total smithing bonuses compared to vanilla Skyrim[/b][/size][/color]
[color=008080][size=3][b] Balanced Crafting Project (full Mod, not just this part)[/b][/size][/color]
 50% (smithing perks) + 5%x4 (enchants on armor) + 4-9% (drop-only potions)
 = 70% (79%) increase total (only a few heavy armors hit armor-cap)
[color=008080][size=3][b] Vanilla Skyrim[/b][/size][/color]
 100% (smithing perks) + 25%x4 (enchants on armor) + 25% (smithing potion)
 = 225% increase total (hit armor-cap with almost anything)

[color=008000][size=4][b]What this Mod does[/b][/size][/color]
 - Tempering ability has been divided between weapons and armor perks
 - All weapons and all armor are now affected by these tempering perks.
 - The different armor perks only add the ability to create those items and a damage bonus, they no longer add the double tempering bonuses.

[color=008000][size=4][b]For Existing Characters[/b][/size][/color]
* To people adding this mod mid-game. All your perks will transfer smoothly. The weaponsmith and armorsmith perks are new though. You will have to add them. You can use the console command to replace missing perks with the new perks or to shift perk points around. (see below)
* I strongly recommend making a new set of armor after installing this mod!

[color=008000][size=4][b]Mod Compatibility[/b][/size][/color]
Smithing Perks Overhaul (SPO) - Not necessary and not compatible. SPO adds more items to some smithing perks. My mod affects all weapons and all armors in the game, so SPO is no longer necessary if you use my mod.
Complete Crafting Overhaul (CCO) - Compatible. Furthermore, my mod removes SPO as a prerequisite to CCO. The load order is not important.
Weapons and Armor Fixes (WAF) - Compatible. The load order is not important.
other mods? - ask in the discussion thread, I will try them out!

[color=008000][size=4][b]Change Log[/b][/size][/color]
V3 - Adds damage bonuses based on armor perks. Looks like an Anvil, raised tempering to 50%.
V0.5 - Lowered max tempering bonus so light armor is just shy of armor-cap at max skill lvls.
V0.4 - removes the Dragon Armor requirement from Master Armorsmith
V0.3 - add support for more armor and weapon types, with weird materials etc
V0.2 - split Daedric off from the Dragon path and made it it\'s own path to Master Armorsmith
V0.1 - the original file

[color=008000][size=4][b]Console Command Help[/b][/size][/color]
 You can add perks and remove perks using their ID and these commands:
 player.addperk ID
 player.removeperk ID
 To get the ID of a perk use this command
 help \"perk name\" 4
 for example: help \"weaponmaster\" 4

[color=008000][size=5][b]Mod Recommendations[/b][/size][/color]
Using this mod with my other Balance mods gives a fully, truly balanced game.
 * [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10521]Balanced Crafting Project - Enchanting Smithing Alchemy[/url] *
 * [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10634]Balanced Armor Effects - Heavy and Light Perks[/url] *
 * [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11076]Balanced Weapon Skill Perks[/url] *
I strongly recommend using these three together.

If you use bows you may also like my [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10037]Improved Archery and Bows[/url] mod :)
